headline.main: Crackdown on Baby Trafficking Zeros In on Websites
headline.print_headline: Police in China Break Up Online Baby-Selling Rings

docs.abstract: The police have broken up four online businesses that matched prospective adoptive parents with children needing homes — in reality, baby traffickers, the police said. Some of the sites posed as public welfare interest groups, or disguised the babies as “gold jewelry.”
docs.snippet: The police have broken up four online businesses that matched prospective adoptive parents with children needing homes — in reality, baby traffickers, the police said. Some of the sites posed as public welfare interest groups, or disguised the...

headline.main: Test Is Improved Predictor of Fetal Disorders
headline.print_headline: New DNA Test Better at Predicting Two Disorders in Babies, a Study Finds

docs.abstract: The screen, called the cell-free DNA test, was 10 times more accurate than now-standard tests in discovering cases of Down syndrome, researchers said.
docs.snippet: The screen, called the cell-free DNA test, was 10 times more accurate than now-standard tests in discovering cases of Down syndrome, researchers said.

docs.lead_paragraph: A DNA test of a pregnant woman's blood is more accurate than current methods of screening for Down syndrome and other common disorders, new research finds. If other studies bear this out, it could transform prenatal care by giving a more reliable, non-invasive way to detect these problems very early in pregnancy.

headline.main: DNA Blood Tests Show Prenatal Screening Promise
headline.print_headline: DNA Blood Tests Show Prenatal Screening Promise

docs.snippet: A DNA test of a pregnant woman's blood is more accurate than current methods of screening for Down syndrome and other common disorders, new research finds. If other studies bear this out, it could transform prenatal care by giving a more reliable,...

docs.lead_paragraph: Standing just over 5 feet, Army Spc. Karen Arvizu is barely a foot taller than the anti-tank missile she carries in both arms and loads into an armored vehicle. She stands on her tip-toes to wrestle open the 300-pound top hatch.

headline.main: Army Study Gives Women Taste of Combat Tasks
headline.print_headline: Army Study Gives Women Taste of Combat Tasks

docs.snippet: Standing just over 5 feet, Army Spc. Karen Arvizu is barely a foot taller than the anti-tank missile she carries in both arms and loads into an armored vehicle. She stands on her tip-toes to wrestle open the 300-pound top hatch.

docs.lead_paragraph: A relaxing of the one-child policy will allow two children in a family when just one parent is an only child, but the cost of child-rearing has given some couples pause.

headline.main: Many in China Can Now Have a Second Child, but Say No
headline.print_headline: Many in China Can Now Have a Second Child, but Say No

docs.abstract: Chinese government has relaxed its one-child policy, allowing two children for couples in which one member is an only child; however, many families say they will not have a second child because of rising cost of child rearing.
docs.snippet: A relaxing of the one-child policy will allow two children in a family when just one parent is an only child, but the cost of child-rearing has given some couples pause.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration is considering a fertility technique that combines the genetic material of three people to avoid certain defects.

headline.main: F.D.A. Weighs Fertility Method That Raises Ethical Questions
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Weighs Fertility Method That Raises Ethical Questions

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration is evaluating a fertility procedure that combines the genetic material of three people to make a baby free of certain defects, therapy that critics say is an ethical minefield and could lead to the creation of designer babies.
docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration is considering a fertility technique that combines the genetic material of three people to avoid certain defects.

headline.main: The Official, if Possibly Unnecessary, End of Acetaminophen Use During Pregnancy

docs.abstract: A study says children whose mothers used acetaminophen during pregnancy were at higher risk of receiving a hospital diagnosis of hyperkinetic disorders, but caution is needed in considering its results.
docs.snippet: A study says children whose mothers used acetaminophen during pregnancy were at higher risk of receiving a hospital diagnosis of hyperkinetic disorders, but caution is needed in considering its results.

docs.lead_paragraph: Only a small fraction of Army women say they'd like to move into one of the newly opening combat jobs, but those few who do say they want a job that takes them right into the heart of battle, according to preliminary results from a survey of the service's nearly 170,000 women.

headline.main: AP Exclusive: Few Army Women Want Combat Jobs
headline.print_headline: AP Exclusive: Few Army Women Want Combat Jobs

docs.lead_paragraph: Even as Indonesia has gotten richer, it has maintained a decentralized system in which most rural women are attended by local midwives.

headline.main: Indonesia Urged to Spend to Make Birth Less Risky
headline.print_headline: Indonesia Urged to Spend to Make Birth Less Risky

docs.abstract: American and Indonesian experts report that Indonesia must make far-reaching and expensive changes in its health care system in order to reduce its high mortality rates of newborns and mothers.
docs.snippet: Even as Indonesia has gotten richer, it has maintained a decentralized system in which most rural women are attended by local midwives.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the coming days, Arizona Gov. Jan Brewer will have to decide whether to sign a proposal to let business owners with strongly held religious beliefs refuse service to gays. The measure is among a spate of hot-button bills the Legislature has sent to the governor since she took office in January 2009.

headline.main: Arizona Governor Has Faced Many Hot-Button Bills
headline.print_headline: Arizona Governor Has Faced Many Hot-Button Bills
